text: <@U03FJQPSC0Y> see screenshot, this is from a HubSpot "build public app" help page (couldn't find it anymore right now, but still had it in Figma). See how it shows the logo to the left of the publisher's name? We couldn't figure out how to do that. Is it possbile? Goal: would help with brand recognition for the average HubSpot user using our app (who wasn't part of the purchasing process).

> _we find it important for end users to recognize what’s custom built and what’s HubSpot built as things get more and more customized._
Quoting you from earlier in this thread. I think it would make it even easier for our users to recognise from a logo or icon. It’s also nice to have when you’re looking through changes made by a Private App in Property History.

We ended up using a cyrillic “о” character, which solved the uniqueness problem for us.

However, an additional “card name” usecase that came up — we would like to provide localizations for the card name.
